(Simplified: 邺)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 業 indicates the sound; 阝 (place) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 業 [ yè ] business, profession; to study, to work
    • 阝 [ yì ] place, town, city
①古地名，在今中國河北省臨漳縣西。
②姓氏。

鄴字的基本解释

鄴
yè
见“邺”。

鄴字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yè］
［《廣韻》魚怯切，入業，疑。］
“邺1”的繁体字。
(1)古都邑名。春秋齐桓公始筑，战国魏文侯建都于此。秦置县。汉后为魏郡治所。东汉末年又先后为冀州、相州治所。袁绍镇此。建安十八年（公元213年），曹操为魏王，定都于此。曹丕代汉，定都洛阳，邺仍与洛阳、长安、谯、许昌合称五都。晋避司马邺（愍帝）讳，改名临漳。十六国时後赵、前秦、北朝东魏、北齐皆定都于此。有二城：北城曹魏因旧城增筑，周二十馀里，北临漳水，城西北隅列峙金虎、铜爵、冰井三台。旧址在今河北省临漳县西南。南城筑于东魏初年，大于北城，今属河南省安阳县辖境。隋开皇十年（公元590年）复名邺县，宋（熙宁）六年（公元1073年）并入临漳。
(2)姓。

鄴字的康熙字典解释

【酉集下】【邑字部】　鄴； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1278第25
【唐韻】【正韻】魚怯切【集韻】逆怯切，?音業。【說文】魏郡縣名。【正字通】今相州鄴城，齊桓公所築。　又【正韻】地名。唐李泌封鄴侯。　又姓。【風俗通】漢有梁令鄴鳳。

Ye
Basic explanation of words
Ye
yè
See "Ye".
Ye
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yè］
["Guangyun" fish is timid, enters the industry, suspicious. ]
"邺1" in traditional characters.
(1) The name of the ancient capital city. In the Spring and Autumn Period, Qi Huan Gong was first built, and the capital of Wei Wenhou during the Warring States Period was built here. Qin Zhi County. After the Han Dynasty, it was the rule of Wei Jun. At the end of the Eastern Han Dynasty, it was successively governed by Jizhou and Xiangzhou. Yuan Shaozhen this. In the eighteenth year of Jian'an (AD 213), Cao Cao was the king of Wei and his capital was here. Cao Pi was the capital of Luoyang in the Han Dynasty. Ye is still called the Five Capitals together with Luoyang, Chang'an, Qiao and Xuchang. Jin avoided Sima Ye (Emperor Min) and changed his name to Linzhang. In the Sixteen Kingdoms period, Zhao, Qianqin, Northern Dynasties, Eastern Wei and Northern Qi all settled here. There are two cities: the northern city of Caowei was built on the basis of the old city. For more than 20 li in the week, it faces Zhangshui to the north. The northwest corner of the city is the three towers of Jinhu, Tongjue and Bingjing. The old site is in the southwest of Linzhang County, Hebei Province. The southern city was built in the early years of the Eastern Wei Dynasty and is larger than the northern city. It is now under the jurisdiction of Anyang County, Henan Province. In the tenth year of Emperor Kaihuang of Sui Dynasty (590 AD), it was renamed Yexian, and in Song (Xining) 6th year (AD 1073) it was merged into Linzhang.
(2) Last name.
Ye
